description: Gets configuration information about a continuous deployment policy.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: The identifier of the continuous deployment policy whose configuration you are getting.

nested_items.name: ContinuousDeploymentPolicyConfig
nested_items.description: Contains the configuration for a continuous deployment policy.

nested_items.name: StagingDistributionDnsNames
nested_items.description: The CloudFront domain name of the staging distribution. For example: d111111abcdef8.cloudfront.net.

nested_items.name: Quantity
nested_items.description: The number of CloudFront domain names in your staging distribution.

nested_items.name: Items
nested_items.description: The CloudFront domain name of the staging distribution.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: A Boolean that indicates whether this continuous deployment policy is enabled (in effect). When this value is true, this policy is enabled and in effect. When this value is false, this policy is not enabled and has no effect.

nested_items.name: TrafficConfig
nested_items.description: Contains the parameters for routing production traffic from your primary to staging distributions.

nested_items.name: SingleWeightConfig
nested_items.description: Contains the percentage of traffic to send to the staging distribution.

nested_items.name: Weight
nested_items.description: The percentage of traffic to send to a staging distribution, expressed as a decimal number between 0 and 0.15. For example, a value of 0.10 means 10% of traffic is sent to the staging distribution.

nested_items.name: SessionStickinessConfig
nested_items.description: Session stickiness provides the ability to define multiple requests from a single viewer as a single session. This prevents the potentially inconsistent experience of sending some of a given user's requests to your staging distribution, while others are sent to your primary distribution. Define the session duration using TTL values.

nested_items.name: IdleTTL
nested_items.description: The amount of time after which you want sessions to cease if no requests are received. Allowed values are 300---3600 seconds (5---60 minutes).

nested_items.name: MaximumTTL
nested_items.description: The maximum amount of time to consider requests from the viewer as being part of the same session. Allowed values are 300---3600 seconds (5---60 minutes).

nested_items.name: SingleHeaderConfig
nested_items.description: Determines which HTTP requests are sent to the staging distribution.

nested_items.name: Header
nested_items.description: The request header name that you want CloudFront to send to your staging distribution. The header must contain the prefix aws-cf-cd-.

nested_items.name: ETag
nested_items.description: The version identifier for the current version of the continuous deployment policy.
